intro: Jamesbrittenia fragilis, commonly known as the brittle jamesbrittenia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a challenging species to cultivate. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Jamesbrittenia fragilis is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
